availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Slevin (Louisville, Kentucky, dry goods merchant. )

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, dry goods merchant. Native of Ireland. Merchant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Dry Goods Merchant in partnership with Thomas P. Cain and Richard D. Slevin in T. & R. Slevin & Cain in Louisville from 1854 to 1877.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 6, p. 246.
Henry Tanner, ed., Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 228.
“T. & R. Slevin & Cain,” The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), September 9, 1854, p. 2.
“Clothing Department, ” The Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), May 11, 1872, p. 4.
“By Thos. Anderson & Co, Auctioneers,” The Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), March 21, 1877, p. 4.
KYR-0001-029-0164.
